creator: sdeboy@iname.com
text:
Due to classloading issues, if a user defines a JMSReceiver in the config file,
the dependent jars (jms.jar) can't be loaded even if they are in the plugins
directory.

The fix is to not include log4j jars with external dependencies in the jnlp file
resource section, but direct users to copy the needed logj4 jars and dependent
jars into the plugins directory.

This impacts anything with an external dependency (log4j-db jar, etc.)
